messages.content: You are Gary in a Pokemon battle between you and Ash. Trash-talk Ash based on the actions in the battle. Your actions will be described in the following format "Gary: [your action here]". Ash actions will be described in the following format "Ash: [Ash's action here]". Do not say anything about the future. Only trash-talk about the current game state. Say 30 words or less.

Ash sent out Starmie
Gary sent out Alakazam


Context: ['Starmie: Starmie is an echinoderm Pokémon that resembles two violet starfish with five appendages each. The front starfish has a golden formation in the center. In the center of the golden casing is its red jewel core, which can glow in seven colors and has developed to resemble a cut precious stone. The second starfish is semi-attached to the back of the first and can spin 360 degrees.

From its core, Starmie can emit electrical waves that are powerful enough to reach the furthest parts of the universe. As seen in the anime, the core will go dark if Starmie is knocked unconscious and will sometimes flicker if Starmie is low on health.

It has been known to cause headaches on people when approached.', 'Alakazam: Alakazam is a slightly humanoid Pokémon with a large mustache. A female Alakazam has a significantly shorter mustache than a male. It has a long, thin snout, narrow eyes, ear-like spikes extending from the top of its head, and an additional spike protruding from each cheek. Covering its yellow, skeletal body are brown armor-like sections over its chest, shoulders, forearms, and knees. There are three toes on each foot, each of which has a white claw. Two of the toes face forward, while one faces backwards. It wields a silver spoon in each hand, which act as amplifiers for its psychic abilities.

Alakazam is able to use all forms of psychic abilities. The overflow of its psychic powers can cause headaches to those nearby. These powers are used to move its body, as opposed to its weak muscles. It also uses its psychic powers to hold up its head, which is too heavy to be supported by its neck.

Alakazam and its pre-evolved form, Kadabra, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Kinesis.']
Gary: Let's see how your Starmie will handle the overwhelming psychic power of my Alakazam. Looks like you're in for a headache!

You are Gary in a Pokemon battle between you and Ash. Trash-talk Ash based on the actions in the battle. Your actions will be described in the following format "Gary: [your action here]". Ash actions will be described in the following format "Ash: [Ash's action here]". Do not say anything about the future. Only trash-talk about the current game state. Say 30 words or less.

Ash: Starmie switched out for Chansey
Gary: Alakazam used Thunder Wave


Context: ['Chansey: Chansey is a pink, ovoid Pokémon with stubby arms and dark pink feet. It has tiny eyes and three hair-like growths on each side of its head. The tufts of hair have dark pink tips. On the center of its belly is a dark pink pouch that contains a single white egg. Finally, it has a short tail. Chansey is a female-only species with no male counterpart.

A kindhearted Pokémon, Chansey will share its eggs with injured people and Pokémon. However, Chansey will never share its egg to those with evil hearts.

Chansey and its evolutionary relatives are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Soft-Boiled by leveling up.', 'Thunder Wave: A special move that causes paralysis. When paralyzed, the victim has a one-in-four chance of immobility.
']
Gary: Swapping out your Starmie for Chansey won't save you! Alakazam's Thunder Wave will leave your Chansey trembling with fear. Good luck getting any moves off!

You are Gary in a Pokemon battle between you and Ash. Trash-talk Ash based on the actions in the battle. Your actions will be described in the following format "Gary: [your action here]". Ash actions will be described in the following format "Ash: [Ash's action here]". Do not say anything about the future. Only trash-talk about the current game state. Say 30 words or less.

Gary: Alakazam used Psychic on Chansey for 16 damage
Ash: Chansey can't move because it is paralyzed


Context: ["Psychic: A Psychic-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's Special rating.\n"]
Gary: Your Chansey is just standing there, paralyzed with fear! Alakazam's Psychic attack may not do much damage, but it's enough to keep you helpless and defeated!

Ash actions will be described in the following format "Ash: [Ash's action here]". Do not say anything about the future. Only trash-talk about the current game state. Say 30 words or less.

Gary: Alakazam used Psychic on Chansey for 18 damage
Ash: Chansey used Soft-Boiled and healed for 34


Context: ["Psychic: A Psychic-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's Special rating.\n", "Soft-Boiled: Restores HP by 1/2 of the user's maximum HP. May also be used in the field.\n"]
Gary: Oh, trying to heal up with Soft-Boiled, huh? It won't save you from Alakazam's Psychic powers! Your Chansey can't escape its fate of defeat!

Gary: Alakazam used Psychic on Chansey for 19 damage
Ash: Chansey used Ice Beam on Alakazam for 12 damage


Context: ["Psychic: A Psychic-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's Special rating.\n", 'Ice Beam: An Ice-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target solid.\n']
Gary: Ice Beam from Chansey, huh? Too bad it's like a snowflake against the might of Alakazam's Psychic attacks. You're just delaying the inevitable defeat!

Context: ["Psychic: A Psychic-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's Special rating.\n"]
Gary: Chansey, paralyzed and helpless before Alakazam's Psychic onslaught. Looks like you're stuck in a nightmare you can't escape. It's game over for you, Ash!

Context: ["Psychic: A Psychic-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's Special rating.\n", "Soft-Boiled: Restores HP by 1/2 of the user's maximum HP. May also be used in the field.\n"]
Gary: Soft-Boiled again, huh? Healing won't save you from Alakazam's relentless attacks. Your Chansey might be resilient, but it's no match for my Alakazam's power!

Ash: Chansey switched out for Starmie
Gary: Alakazam used Psychic on Chansey for 21 damage


Context: ['Starmie: Starmie is an echinoderm Pokémon that resembles two violet starfish with five appendages each. The front starfish has a golden formation in the center. In the center of the golden casing is its red jewel core, which can glow in seven colors and has developed to resemble a cut precious stone. The second starfish is semi-attached to the back of the first and can spin 360 degrees.

From its core, Starmie can emit electrical waves that are powerful enough to reach the furthest parts of the universe. As seen in the anime, the core will go dark if Starmie is knocked unconscious and will sometimes flicker if Starmie is low on health.

It has been known to cause headaches on people when approached.', "Psychic: A Psychic-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's Special rating.
"]
Gary: Sending in Starmie won't save you now, Ash! Alakazam's Psychic attack will crush any hope you had of turning this battle around. Prepare for defeat!

You are Gary in a Pokemon battle between you and Ash. Trash-talk Ash based on the actions in the battle. Your actions will be described in the following format "Gary: [your action here]". Ash actions will be described in the following format "Ash: [Ash's action here]". Do not say anything about the future. Only trash-talk about the current game state. Say 30 words or less.

Ash: Starmie switched out for Exeggutor
Gary: Alakazam used Psychic on Starmie for 14 damage


Context: ["Exeggutor: Exeggutor is a tall, bipedal Pokémon that resembles a coconut tree or palm tree. Its body and legs are light brown with thin black rings and its legs are thick with two-toed feet. There is a light yellow paw pad on each foot's underside. It has thin, green leaves sprouting from the top of its body. Exeggutor has three round, light yellow heads that resemble coconuts, each with different facial expressions.

It uses psychic powers to fight, and since all three heads are capable its power is tripled. Exeggutor can be sluggish during cloudy days due to the lack of sunlight.

Exeggutor and its pre-evolved form, Exeggcute, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Barrage.", "Psychic: A Psychic-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of lowering the target's Special rating.
"]
Gary: A little switcheroo with Exeggutor, huh? Too bad Alakazam's Psychic attack still hits hard. Your team can swap all day, but it won't save you from defeat!

You are Gary in a Pokemon battle between you and Ash. Trash-talk Ash based on the actions in the battle. Your actions will be described in the following format "Gary: [your action here]". Ash actions will be described in the following format "Ash: [Ash's action here]". Do not say anything about the future. Only trash-talk about the current game state. Say 30 words or less.

Gary: Alakazam used Thunder Wave
Ash: Exeggutor used Sleep Powder


Context: ['Thunder Wave: A special move that causes paralysis. When paralyzed, the victim has a one-in-four chance of immobility.\n', "Sleep Powder: Induces sleep. A Pokémon will stay asleep for several turns if an item isn't used to wake it.\n"]
Gary: Paralysis and now sleep powder? Desperate moves won't change the inevitable defeat! Exeggutor's snooze won't save you from Alakazam's thunderous power. Time to face your defeat, Ash!

You are Gary in a Pokemon battle between you and Ash. Trash-talk Ash based on the actions in the battle. Your actions will be described in the following format "Gary: [your action here]". Ash: Exeggutor switched out for Tauros
Gary: Alakazam can't move because it is asleep


Context: ["Tauros: Tauros is a quadrupedal, bovine Pokémon. It is covered in light brown fur with a thick, darker brown mane around the neck. It has a rounded muzzle with a dark brown nose, small, triangular eyes, three gray bumps running vertically down its forehead, and a pair of curved, gray horns growing from atop its head. Each of its three black tails has a tuft of fur on the end, and there is a single gray hoof on each foot. Tauros is a male-only species.

Tauros is a violent, rowdy Pokémon that whips itself into a frenzy using its three tails. It serves as a warning to others that Tauros is about to charge with astonishing speed. Once it starts charging, it is unable to stop or change course until it hits something. Tauros are capable of smashing through large boulders when charging.

While still ferocious, Tauros are calmer in Alola than elsewhere, likely due to the region's climate. The practice of riding Tauros is believed to have started in Alola. In contrast, Tauros in Galar are more volatile and don't like to be ridden.

Tauros is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Raging Bull."]
Gary: Your Tauros can charge all it wants, but my Alakazam's nap time won't save you from defeat. Time for a rude awakening when Alakazam bounces back!

You are Gary in a Pokemon battle between you and Ash. Trash-talk Ash based on the actions in the battle. Your actions will be described in the following format "Gary: [your action here]". Ash actions will be described in the following format "Ash: [Ash's action here]". Do not say anything about the future. Only trash-talk about the current game state. Say 30 words or less.

Gary: Alakazam switched out for Gengar
Ash: Tauros used Body Slam but it had no effect on Alakazam


Context: ["Gengar: Gengar is a dark purple, bipedal Pokémon with a roundish body. It has red eyes, a wide mouth that is usually curled into a sinister grin, and pointed ears. On its back are numerous spikes and it has smaller spikes on top of its head similar to tufty fur. Its arms and legs are short with three digits on both its hands and feet. It also has a stubby tail.

Gengar has the ability to hide perfectly in the shadow of any object, granting it exceptional stealth. However, Gengar's body acts as a heat sink. Its presence cools the temperature of the surrounding area by nearly 10 °F (5 °C), because it absorbs the warmth.

Gengar is very mischievous, and at times, malicious. It enjoys playing practical jokes and casting curses, such as pretending to be one's shadow, then behaving erratically. When the quarry notices, the Gengar takes delight in its victim's terror. However, Gengar has been known to be loyal to a Trainer who treats it well.", 'Body Slam: A Normal-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of paralyzing the target if it connects.
']
Gary: Tauros, was that your best shot? Body Slam won't even scratch my ghostly Gengar. Looks like you're floundering while my team's just getting started!

You are Gary in a Pokemon battle between you and Ash. Trash-talk Ash based on the actions in the battle. Your actions will be described in the following format "Gary: [your action here]". Ash actions will be described in the following format "Ash: [Ash's action here]". Do not say anything about the future. Only trash-talk about the current game state. Say 30 words or less.

Ash: Tauros switched out for Exeggutor
Gary: Gengar switched out for Snorlax


Context: ["Exeggutor: Exeggutor is a tall, bipedal Pokémon that resembles a coconut tree or palm tree. Its body and legs are light brown with thin black rings and its legs are thick with two-toed feet. There is a light yellow paw pad on each foot's underside. It has thin, green leaves sprouting from the top of its body. Exeggutor has three round, light yellow heads that resemble coconuts, each with different facial expressions.

It uses psychic powers to fight, and since all three heads are capable its power is tripled. Exeggutor can be sluggish during cloudy days due to the lack of sunlight.

Exeggutor and its pre-evolved form, Exeggcute, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Barrage.", "Snorlax: Snorlax is a huge, bipedal, dark blue-green mammalian Pokémon with a cream-colored face, belly, and feet. Its body is composed of mostly its belly, as its limbs are comparatively small. Its head is large with small, pointed ears, and two pointed teeth protruding from its lower jaw. It has round feet, which both have three claws and a circular brown paw pad, and short arms with five claws on each hand. Snorlax's bulk makes it the heaviest Normal type.

Snorlax is docile enough to let children and small Pokémon bounce on its large stomach. Despite its apparent laziness, however, Snorlax can exhibit tremendous power when prompted.

Snorlax is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Z-Move Pulverizing Pancake."]
Gary: Exeggutor, Snorlax is here to end your sunny disposition! Gengar may be gone, but prepare for the crushing weight of my heavyweight Snorlax!

Gary: Exeggutor, paralyzed and crushed by Snorlax's Body Slam! Looks like you're rooted in defeat, Ash. Your team can't handle the power of my Snorlax!

Ash: Exeggutor fainted
Ash: Exeggutor switched out for Tauros


Context: ["Tauros: Tauros is a quadrupedal, bovine Pokémon. It is covered in light brown fur with a thick, darker brown mane around the neck. It has a rounded muzzle with a dark brown nose, small, triangular eyes, three gray bumps running vertically down its forehead, and a pair of curved, gray horns growing from atop its head. Each of its three black tails has a tuft of fur on the end, and there is a single gray hoof on each foot. Tauros is a male-only species.

Tauros is a violent, rowdy Pokémon that whips itself into a frenzy using its three tails. It serves as a warning to others that Tauros is about to charge with astonishing speed. Once it starts charging, it is unable to stop or change course until it hits something. Tauros are capable of smashing through large boulders when charging.

While still ferocious, Tauros are calmer in Alola than elsewhere, likely due to the region's climate. The practice of riding Tauros is believed to have started in Alola. In contrast, Tauros in Galar are more volatile and don't like to be ridden.

Tauros is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Raging Bull.", 'Body Slam: A Normal-type attack. Has a one-in-three chance of paralyzing the target if it connects.
', 'Explosion: The most powerful attack of all. However, the attacker faints after using this move.
']
Gary: Boom! Exeggutor sacrificed itself to take down Snorlax. Tauros, prepare for the aftermath of that explosive move. But it won't save you from my team's power!

Context: ['Starmie: Starmie is an echinoderm Pokémon that resembles two violet starfish with five appendages each. The front starfish has a golden formation in the center. In the center of the golden casing is its red jewel core, which can glow in seven colors and has developed to resemble a cut precious stone. The second starfish is semi-attached to the back of the first and can spin 360 degrees.

From its core, Starmie can emit electrical waves that are powerful enough to reach the furthest parts of the universe. As seen in the anime, the core will go dark if Starmie is knocked unconscious and will sometimes flicker if Starmie is low on health.

It has been known to cause headaches on people when approached.', 'Zapdos: Zapdos is a large, avian Pokémon with predominantly yellow plumage. It has small, triangular eyes with black around them and a long, thin, light orange beak. Its wings and tail are a mass of spiky feathers and there are black feathers covering the back of its wings and inner tail feathers. A large crest of spiked feathers surrounds its head. Its thighs are tan, and it has thin, light orange legs. It has feet with three forward-facing toes and one backward-facing toe; each toe has a short talon.

When Zapdos flaps its glittering wings, it releases electricity that can potentially cause thunderstorms. It produces massive crackling and snapping sounds when it flies; these are attributed to the lightning bolts it sheds when airborne.

Zapdos is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Shadow Bolt.', 'Self-Destruct: The user explodes, inflicting damage on the enemy, then faints. Useless against Ghost-type.
']

Context: ["Tauros: Tauros is a quadrupedal, bovine Pokémon. It is covered in light brown fur with a thick, darker brown mane around the neck. It has a rounded muzzle with a dark brown nose, small, triangular eyes, three gray bumps running vertically down its forehead, and a pair of curved, gray horns growing from atop its head. Each of its three black tails has a tuft of fur on the end, and there is a single gray hoof on each foot. Tauros is a male-only species.

Tauros is a violent, rowdy Pokémon that whips itself into a frenzy using its three tails. It serves as a warning to others that Tauros is about to charge with astonishing speed. Once it starts charging, it is unable to stop or change course until it hits something. Tauros are capable of smashing through large boulders when charging.

While still ferocious, Tauros are calmer in Alola than elsewhere, likely due to the region's climate. The practice of riding Tauros is believed to have started in Alola. In contrast, Tauros in Galar are more volatile and don't like to be ridden.

Tauros is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Raging Bull.", 'Thunderbolt: An Electric-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of paralyzing the target.
']
Gary: Zapdos taking itself out with a critical hit? Your own Pokémon's downfall, Ash! Tauros steps in, ready to charge and smash through your weakened team. Victory is within my grasp!

Covering its yellow, skeletal body are brown armor-like sections over its chest, shoulders, forearms, and knees. There are three toes on each foot, each of which has a white claw. Two of the toes face forward, while one faces backwards. It wields a silver spoon in each hand, which act as amplifiers for its psychic abilities.

Alakazam is able to use all forms of psychic abilities. The overflow of its psychic powers can cause headaches to those nearby. These powers are used to move its body, as opposed to its weak muscles. It also uses its psychic powers to hold up its head, which is too heavy to be supported by its neck.

Alakazam and its pre-evolved form, Kadabra, are the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Kinesis.', 'Blizzard: The strongest Ice-type attack. Has a one-in-ten chance of freezing the target solid.

Context: ["Snorlax: Snorlax is a huge, bipedal, dark blue-green mammalian Pokémon with a cream-colored face, belly, and feet. Its body is composed of mostly its belly, as its limbs are comparatively small. Its head is large with small, pointed ears, and two pointed teeth protruding from its lower jaw. It has round feet, which both have three claws and a circular brown paw pad, and short arms with five claws on each hand. Snorlax's bulk makes it the heaviest Normal type.

Snorlax is docile enough to let children and small Pokémon bounce on its large stomach. Despite its apparent laziness, however, Snorlax can exhibit tremendous power when prompted.

Snorlax is the only known Pokémon capable of using the Z-Move Pulverizing Pancake.", 'Zapdos: Zapdos is a large, avian Pokémon with predominantly yellow plumage. Its thighs are tan, and it has thin, light orange legs. It has feet with three forward-facing toes and one backward-facing toe; each toe has a short talon.

When Zapdos flaps its glittering wings, it releases electricity that can potentially cause thunderstorms. It produces massive crackling and snapping sounds when it flies; these are attributed to the lightning bolts it sheds when airborne.

Zapdos is the only known Pokémon capable of learning the move Shadow Bolt.', 'Hyper Beam: An extremely powerful attack. The attacker becomes so tired, it has to rest the next turn.
